alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 05 at 9:19AM CDT until November 05 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN PUTNAM...SOUTHEASTERN WHITESIDE...NORTHEASTERN HENRY AND BUREAU COUNTIES... At 918 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Portland Corners to near Thomas to near Buda, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Morrison, Henry, Prophetstown, Erie, Walnut, Wyanet, Sheffield, Tiskilwa, Tampico, Lyndon, Buda, Bureau Junction, Hooppole, Deer Grove, Putnam, Fenton, Neponset, Yorktown and Round Grove. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
